data.title: Online gambling sites lure over 4m young Thais
data.description: More than four million young Thai people have been drawn into online gambling, which risks developing into an addiction that takes a toll on their health, according to experts.

data.title: Rama II motorway construction put on hold after fatal crane collapse
data.description: Transport Minister Suriya Jungrungreangkit has ordered work on a city motorway to be suspended for two weeks after Friday

data.title: Flood death toll rises to nine in South
data.description: SONGKHLA - The death toll from the worst floods in decades in southern Thailand climbed to nine on Saturday, as thousands of people were evacuated due to rising water levels.

data.title: 31 crew from Thai boats ‘taken into Myanmar’
data.description: More than 30 crew members of Thai  fishing boats  were detained in  Myanmar  waters on Saturday after three Myanmar patrol vessels opened fire on them, leaving one person dead and two injured, a navy commander said.

data.title: Boat with 110 Rohingya arrives in Indonesia
data.description: JAKARTA - More than 110 Rohingya refugees came ashore in Aceh province of Indonesia on Saturday after their boat nearly sank, UN refugee agency officials and the local government said, as growing numbers arrive by sea in the country.

data.title: German woman bitten by fish in Phangnga
data.description: PHANGNGA - Authorities have issued a warning to tourists in Takua Pa district of this southern Thai province after a German tourist was bitten by an unidentified fish, leaving an oval-shaped wound approximately 20 centimetres long.

data.title: Two fake policemen nabbed
data.description: Two Thai men have been arrested for posing as police to rob Vietnamese tourists in Bangkok.

data.title: Two tourists drown in Samui
data.description: SURAT THANI - Two people, one of them a Russian tourist, have drowned near Chaweng Beach on Koh Samui due to strong waves.

data.title: Israel says strike killed Oct 7 attacker
data.description: The Israeli military said in Saturday that it killed a Palestinian who was involved in the Oct 7, 2023 Hamas attack in a strike on a vehicle in Gaza. It is investigating claims that the person was an employee of the food aid group World Central Kitchen.

data.title: Vietnam approves $67bn high-speed rail megaproject
data.description: Vietnam will start building a $67-billion  high-speed rail  network to connect its northern and southern regions in 2027, as the government plans major infrastructure projects to support its economic growth ambitions.

data.title: Cameroonian-Thai duo arrested in ‘CP’ export scam
data.description: A Cameroonian man and a Thai woman have been arrested for operating a company that deceived buyers into thinking it was affiliated with a major agribusiness company, resulting in more than 3.5 million baht in damages, police say.

data.title: New Bang Yai-Kanchanaburi motorway toll-free over New Year
data.description: The new  motorway  that will link Bang Yai district in Nonthaburi with  Kanchanaburi  province will be open for motorists to travel free of charge over the New Year holiday period.

data.title: Leicester City name Van Nistelrooy as new coach
data.description: LONDON -  Leicester City  have appointed former Manchester United star  Ruud van Nistelrooy  as their new manager on a contract until June 2027, the Premier League football club has announced.

data.title: Ethnic Tai Yai people celebrate traditional New Year
data.description: Event organised by Tai Yai Ethnic Association marks beginning of the Tai Yai lunar calendar

data.title: NESDC calls for urgent action to manage EV battery waste
data.description: While electric vehicles are touted as eco-friendly solution, their batteries pose  significant environmental challenge if not handled responsibly

data.title: Nearly 5 million Thai children and youth are gamblers, study reveals
data.description: Scholars caution against establishment of entertainment complexes and casinos

data.title: Myanmar vessel attacks Thai fishing boats: one killed, 31 captured
data.description: Thai patrol boat arrived at scene to assist, transported injured to Ranong

data.title: Thailand secures historic free-trade agreement with EFTA
data.description: Significant milestone in Thailand's trade history as its first FTA with European countries

data.title: DSI summary on PTT-OR corruption case is fake news, agency says
data.description: Investigation into fraud allegations is not yet over, DSI says

data.title: Nation Foundation cooks up meals for flood victims in Hat Yai
data.description: Food will be delivered to communities in Hat Yai district, Songkhla province, that have been hit by floods this week

data.title: Pornographer captured after keeping victim, 10, on boat for a month
data.description: A 10-year-old child has been rescued by police after being sexually assaulted offshore of Rayong province for nearly a month.

data.title: Drug crackdown at the border: the Wa issue
data.description: Thai government faces challenges destroying drug production sites and safe houses in minority-dominated border areas

data.title: US approves $385 million arms sale to Taiwan
data.description: WASHINGTON — The United States State Department has approved the potential sale of spare parts for F-16 jets and radars to Taiwan for an estimated US$385 million, the Pentagon said on Friday, a day before Taiwan President Lai Ching-te starts a sensitive Pacific trip.

data.title: Floodwaters recede in Hat Yai's economic areas
data.description: SONGKHLA — Floodwaters have begun to recede in the economic zones of Hat Yai, while other parts of the tourist district remain inundated.

data.title: Thailand gears up for petroleum exploration in Andaman Sea
data.description: Government looks to tap alternative resources as talks with Cambodia yet to take off

data.title: Drone Tech Asia 2024 Showcases Cutting-Edge UAV Innovations
data.description: More than 60 leading companies from the sector took part, presenting more than 100 brands

data.title: German tourist suffers severe injury after being bitten while swimming
data.description: Local authorities in Khao Lak don’t rule out shark attack
